website_summaries.verdict: Choose this model if your garden and your bank account are small because it's designed and priced to fit both
pros: Can cut paths of 14 inches wide and 6.5 inches deep, making it a great choice for small gardens and minor landscaping projects
cons: Won't do much for soil that's rocky or cut through thick vegetation
Handle is collapsible and has been reported to break

customer_reviews.title: Got exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Pros and cons.. Pro it's not light, it's heavy, you don't want light if you are trying to till, I actually wish it was heavier, but I ratchet strapped a cinder block to the handle rails.. that worked. Pro it's very torqy, no lag, it made a job that used to take me a day by hand take 15min.. we have hard clay soil.. no problem for this thing.. Con The design for the handle is weird, it isn't a natural way to control it.. It doesn't easily fold. There's no wheels to roll it when you're done. Verdict Works perfectly for what I need and made my life easier.. I'd buy another..
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: you will probably do just fine. It probably won't trip your 20 amp breaker ...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a tiller for turning over an acre. This is a backyard gardener's tiller. It doesn't deal well with clay mixed with water, but what do you expect from a relatively cheap workhorse? If you don't try to turn over the dirt in your clay pit just after a rain, you will probably do just fine. It probably won't trip your 20 amp breaker (which I like). It was easy to put together. It hosed off nicely. What more can I ask for from such a device? I can't think of anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about buying something I new nothing about online. I am certainly glad I bought this tiller. It has performed well beyond my expectations. I had to till about 550 SQ ft. of my front lawn to replace grass killed by hurricane Irma and this electric tiller did a remarkable job and saved me about 2 days of manual labor as I am handicapped and have to take breaks often. It is very poweful for an electric device.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Works great but be careful.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The trigger sticks someone's and I have to mash the small release button a few times to get it to stop it just pull the plug. Could be dangerous for some who aren't strong enough to control it and pull out/mash button repeatedly, but for me it's just a minor inconvenience. Works great and does a fantastic job otherwise. Have not had any overheat issues but we're have a relatively small garden.
customer_reviews.author: by Dustin F.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Handles (Break Easily)
customer_reviews.text: Well at first I was extremely impressed considering how infective the appearance was to the functionality. However, My initial concern was realized when the very low quality hollow plastic handles snapped over the course of the natural vibration from the machine in use. Overall, if this issue was resolved with its design flaw I’d buy something like it with better quality parts as the Sun Joe brand Pole Saw I bought seems to functioned perfectly and appear much better quality in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Aggravation
customer_reviews.text: I'm so angry, bought this and put it together, After checking the outlets and extension cord 18 g..I could not get this to work, For 2 days I tried to figure out why, neighbors tried as well...needed to get things done before Memorial Day Monday picnic I am having. Customer service was very nice, however, I cant get replacement for 3 to 5 days and seeing as it's a holiday weekend, it'll most likely be even longer....to put it mildly....I'm a very unhappy customer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with my tiller
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my!! I am in love with my tiller. I won't let my husband use it! I have a lot of really crappy Johnson grass, etc., in my yard. Dug them up with ease. I am a little over 5'. But, I had no trouble getting and keeping control of this tiller. I did a 20' by 20' square in a very short time and, as you know if you have Johnson grass, etc., -- they have long, tough roots.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Small electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: I used this to till a small garden spot in my backyard and it worked great. Assembly was easy although it took a bit since there were no step 2's just went from step 1 to 3; pictures were more helpful than the words. It is small so fits easy into my small shed and doesn't seem to be that heavy. This is a corded electric tiller so make sure you have a good extension cord and keep it out of the way when tilling.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: can a over 70 year old do a tilling job?
customer_reviews.text: You bet:) I have all ways wanted to till my gardens. Sun Joe tiller is a great little tiller. When I plugged in and started to tear up the sod along side of the privacy fence, it kicked up the hidden field stones!! No, worries for this little tiller girl. The only problem I had was the tall crab grass roots would wrap around around the base of the blades, disconnected the power source PLUG from (250' commericial extention cord) Let it cool down and got pliers to free up the wound up roots, (whew) and started again. Now I can't hardly wait ti see my garden bloom.
customer_reviews.author: millicent doan

customer_reviews.title: This works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I had heart trouble and for two years I left it in the shed. this is my first year using this machine and it accomplished everything I expected it to do. I have a 40 x 80 city lot with a house and only needed it in two places this year. I finished both places in a day. The only trouble I had was with "creeping charley" ("wandering jenny" in the south) the vine got caught in blades a few times. If I took my time over the "jenny" the blades would chew it up. -So - plan your job and take your time and you will be very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I lost about 50 square feet of lawn last year to beetles. It is heavily shaded area and ground was heavily compacted. I wasn't sure this little roto would work. Wow. Chewed up the dirt real good for the 2" I wanted to replant. Easy to handle and doesn't drag you around. Goes where you want it to go. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wattles

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but pretty powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller! It is exactly what I needed for my garden. Easy to use, lightweight, tills up my garden initially and helps me keep weeds down. The only annoying part so far is if I am tilling up an area with tall weeds I have to stop every so often to untangle the weeds because it starts bogging down. Very happy with my purchase so far. I have used it 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: boone17

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a bargain. I am 71 years old and I can't do the digging with a shovel in my garden anymore. Tiller Joe is an answer to my needs. Went together in a snap. Took a few minutes learning how to guide it. Went out to the garden spent 30 minutes doing what would have taken a long time busting up the top layer with a shovel. I was thinking about buying a more expensive gas powered tiller, but I just get too tired pulling a starter cord. Got rid of my gas mower and bought an electric for the same reason. This is a very good product at a very reasonable price. Tiller Joe got it right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller.
customer_reviews.text: Wow very surprised by how well this worked. Works great did a 20 by 20 section for a new garden had it tiller up in less than 30 min. This tiller works best when you pull instead of pushing it forward. Nice an light but and easy to put together. Even thinking about tilling up my half acre yard with this
customer_reviews.author: eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, how I love it! I am older and have arthritis, yet I was able to use this little gem to dig up my garden and flower beds with ease. I put it together myself (and I'm a woman ;)) The plug stays put and the cord is out of the way. the controls are immediate and easy to use. It's powerful and will dig pretty deep if you let it. The tines are easy to clean with a hose. I can carry it with one hand. Good little tiller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marshell Wooley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended tiller.
customer_reviews.text: We like this tiller because it is just the right size for the small areas we need tilling. It is easy to use but give it a few tries to get comfortable with it. It gets the job done very well and we have a clay like hard soil and it broke it down really well.
customer_reviews.author: evylyn

customer_reviews.title: Think Green Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Works and I like the Ideal of getting away from Fuel but you do have to deal with a cord. For small jobs it's perfect but it you have to get serious this is not the Tiller you need. I have a 6 HP 24" Front Tiller Gas Job and it does the hard work and then I use this to do the easier tilling. And I also don't work it to hard cause I've heard from other user's the motor might get hot. I would say it's a over sized Hoe, LOL
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Averett

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have six raised garden beds that I used the Sun Joe to till. Plenty of power to bust up some of the clay in the beds. Took an hour and a half to do each bed. Way better than doing it by hand that takes forever. Wish I'd bought it a couple of years ago. Look forward to spring planting now!
customer_reviews.author: Hook em Horns

customer_reviews.title: SUN JOE ELECTRIC TILLER
customer_reviews.text: When we bought this little gem I had my doubts and told my husband to keep the box in case we had to return it. Well it proved me wrong! By far this is the best tiller we have ever owned. Our soil is rocky and hard. The tiller dug in without bogging down or straining. Best money we ever spent!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Horrible build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Motor seized up after a single season of light work. Support phone number goes nowhere (you are instructed to email instead by an automated system message and then it hungs up on you). I think these cheapo landscaping tools should be thought as an annual subscription more than a lifelong power tool you will buy once then own and operate for years if not decades. What I mean by that is that you pay $50 to $100 per year to get a brand new replacement "tool" each year since that seems to be how long these things last at the most.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie C

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My grass in the back yard died, about 75%. I'm using this to turn over the soil and plant new grass. The yard is 5000 sqr. ft. and I need to do 3000 of it. So far it has worked great. I've done half so far and the grass is growing great. Finish the rest in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Batcat

customer_reviews.title: Soft aerated soil without the noise and toxic exaust.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Gas powered tillers are such a pain. Load and toxic. Sun Joe tiller is quite clean and works well. If you use it to till your garden or yard it works great. Strong enough to till through small roots and gets deep enough to plant or just to aerate soil. Turned my hard soil into soft soil for planting.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great cultivator. Fast delivery, secure packaging, easy to assemble and it cut through a ton of weeds and churned up the clay soil very quickly. Easy to use and easy to clean. I was so impressed with this Sun Joe product I bought one of their lawn mowers too. This company makes very useful products!
customer_reviews.author: Terry J. Eickman

customer_reviews.title: Poor motor design. Not rugged at all.
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK for 2 years of very occasional use. Then failed. After inspection, the unit has design issues. The China motor is in a plastic frame. The frame is flimsy and is not designed to retain the motor bearings for thrust loads. Since it is mounted vertically. these would be the up and down loads while running over any bumps or rough ground. The bearings while slide out of the cheap frame and then the lower end of the rotor is rubbing the stator and the unit is junk.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light, easy to use machine...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really easy to use, does the job machine. You push forward and it digs up the dirt & weeds. When you pull back it does an even better job. I could give it 5 stars just as easily. We have always done this weeding/tilling by hand but this is way better. Just watch the cord. It's light so it's easy to carry around and the blades seem very hard and had no problem pulling out some rocks... I hope it lasts season after season. Get a nice, long, outdoor extension cord. I do recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Reiff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little tiller
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfect for me for weed control. It stays pretty shallow, so it works well if you are just trying chop up the top few inches. It is exactly what I had hoped it would be. Lightweight, easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine for the oney
customer_reviews.text: I have used it three times since I received it and it has all the power I can handle. I gave it a 4 rating because the electric cord can be a pain when using. Something to consider when purchasing. You have to be within 100 ft of an outlet or they say you can damage the motor.
customer_reviews.author: general wizard

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  A quick review.
customer_reviews.text: A great product. This is the 2nd we bought - this was a gift. Been using ours for years. We also have a much larger Craftsman tiller with a 5 HP engine, but now use this exclusively. Light, easier to use, and quicker. Much less tiring than the traditional tiller. Breaks up the soil better, too. Doesn't go quite as deep as the industrial tiller, but for home garden use is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Members

customer_reviews.title: good support. Bad unit replaced
customer_reviews.text: Well, missed my return window, now stuck with a tiller that has all the wrong pieces and can't be put together. I'll be trying to get the right pieces from the manufacturer, and will update review if I can get 2 handles of the same length that can be attached to the cross piece and base, but as of now... left handle piece is wrong length. Update from * to ***: Snow Joe has been good so far with a replacement. Should be getting it in a bit, will update again upon successful new unit. Updated from *** to *****. Late on the update, but manufacturer shipped a working unit in good time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for.  BUY it today.
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not write a review on things but was so impressed with this I had to share. If I could I would give it a 10 star I would. Cut my garden raised beds. Cut sod as making another small garden same as the raised bed dug up nice. Now I guess there will be more Flower Beds when wife finds out so easy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money and the wait
customer_reviews.text: It took a month to show up. But now that it's finally here.... I love it honestly. I think it works great. Super Easy to use and very light. My husband loves it too. The extension cord gets in my way a lot but that's something I have to learn to work with. I did a 8×8ft section in less than 10mins. I'm glad I bought it. Was worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed of how powerful this little tiller is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tiller for a small new 30x30 garden. Once we dug up the grass, I was amazed of how powerful this little tiller is. It took me a a bit to figure out that going forward as well as backwards over the row, a little at a time gave it the perfect depth. It even worked well through the little rocks it dug up. The only downfall is of course the vibrating and holding it in place, due to not having any wheels. For the money, it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Ran for 30 seconds before engine seized
customer_reviews.text: I've had several sun joe products in the past and have always been very happy with them. This unit had somewhat misaligned pre-drilled holes..not a huge deal, but within 30 seconds of use the engine seized. Very disappointed, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Zillhart

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job tilling up flower beds
customer_reviews.text: This machine is harder to maneuver than I thought it would be. My husband is taller and it was easier for him. Does a good job tilling up the soil. The price was Definitely worth it to have one at home to use when we need it vs renting one.
customer_reviews.author: Kath66

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Fun to Run
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of power and durability. I was so surprised. Perfect for many tilling jobs small to medium. A good weight to work with and the weight balances it out nicely. Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I own 2 because I like it so much.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second one I purchased for my Florida home so I could have one at each home; the other is in Minnesota. I loved it so much I bought a second one. Works fantastic for my vegetable gardens and general grounds work.
customer_reviews.author: Mayjee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I have 3 plots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I have 3 plots: a 10x20, a 30x10 and a 6x10. I was able to till all 3 plots with ease (taking time off in between to remove rocks, break up chunks, or remove tuft of grass). Made mixing in compost easy as could be. Much more than I expected for an electric tiller.
customer_reviews.author: ricky

customer_reviews.title: Great for small garden
customer_reviews.text: I have two raised bed gardens (8x10), this tiller does an excellent job on them. Its lightweight and very easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller. It helps create gardens and get rid of weeds so quickly. Time and back saver. Only downside is it gets tangled with certain weeds, and twice so far a rock has gotten jammed in it. I don't think that's the product's fault though.
customer_reviews.author: Rugger88

customer_reviews.title: This tiller works much better backwards than forwards
customer_reviews.text: This tiller worked exactly as I needed. I have a small flowerbed (8 X 40ft) that has to be prepared each spring and I was doing it manually with a hoe and rake. It took about 1 hour or so to till it all up by hand. Using this unit, it took about 10 minutes. A word of advice: This tiller works much better backwards than forwards. Not sure if that's how you are supposed to use it but it really digs in better going in reverse. If you have a small or medium area and it's not made of clay, this unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: sgg

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tool in my shed!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this tiller for 2 years now. My friend had one and let us borrow hers, and I instantly fell in love with it. It is strong enough to till through grass to make way for flower beds. We have a full size gas-powered tiller to till our garden, but I am not able to use it because of the strength it takes to use it. You will be surprised at how strong this little machine is and how easily it will till through dirt. You will need to be careful with larger rocks and remove them, or they will cause a jam.
customer_reviews.author: Marge0808

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it.....I have done so much with this. The first one we bought had oil stains on it and it woudlnt turn on so we figured who ever returned it tried to put oil in it and it doesn't need it. but the second one arrived right away and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: almaz getachew

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. I'm putting in a bunch of landscaping and ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I'm putting in a bunch of landscaping and needed to amend the soil. This little guy cut through medium density clay with ease. It makes blending in better top soil a snap. It's super light and easy to carry around the yard. I particularly like the fact that it turns on easily vs a gas version which can be problematic. If there is any downside, it's that pine straw will wrap around the tiller axel. That not a big deal, just rake first and move on. If mine ever breaks, I'd buy a new one ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tiller because my gas operated one died. After reading so many positive reviews, I had to give it a shot. The shipping was prompt and when I opened the box, I found that the assembly was simple. Just attach the handles and the guide for the cord. My backyard consists of hard clay. This little tiller ate right through it. It did a better job than my gas operated tiller did. It broke the ground into fine particles of dirt and didn't leave any clods. Once you get the technique down, you can really accomplish a big job in a short amount of time. This is definately worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley P. Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small to medium garden.
customer_reviews.text: It tore the ground up pretty good. Easy to assemble. Easy to use.Only thing negative is the plug kept coming unplugged and that's annoying to stop every minute and plug it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Tyyzmom

customer_reviews.title: Used this all day and worked like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Worked all my garden areas at my new home getting ready to plant. Used this all day and worked like a champ. Exactly what I wanted. I have some small areas I wanted to get tilled also so I'm glad this doesn't have wheels. Arms did get a little tired by the end of the second day not being able to rest it without having to stop and find a place to lean it. Highly recommend it for the home gardener.
customer_reviews.author: OGD Family

customer_reviews.title: Not at all bad for an electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: Not at all bad for an electric tiller. We've tilled almost every area we needed tilled, except one. The one spot is in dire need of care, the tiller did what it could. I find it satisfactory for our light tilling and cultivating needs. It's light, strong enough, handles are mostly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: chris geralds

customer_reviews.title: A back saver!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and gets the job done. Beats shoveling dirt all day. The amount of work it takes to shovel a 10' x 10' area would take at least a day of physical hard labor. With this, it took me no more than 30 minutes and it does a really good job.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for our backyard garden
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect for our backyard garden. Really digs DEEP! We've tried other electric items that were a joke, but this is wonderful. Let a friend borrow it as he didn't believe us either, and he immediately bought one for his mother. Our small garden is about 10x20, and it does wonderfully and it's lightweight enough that either of us can use it, or even our friends elderly mother can use it for her flower beds! I'd recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: J. Deloach

customer_reviews.title: Good product, just don't overwork it.
customer_reviews.text: Just need to be fairly careful not to get this overheated. After about 20-30 minutes, I needed to let it cool off for half an hour or so. Not a big deal, but if you've got lots of garden to till up, you might need to upgrade to something more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny B

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Makes quick work of preparing soil for ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Makes quick work of preparing soil for planting. Has some weight to it but managable. Even hit some concrete and roots with no apparent damage. Bounced a lil bit when i hit the roots but all in all easier to handle than i had expected. Seemed as though the handles weren't going to fit during assembly, but got it to work by alternating sides while tightening wing nuts. Already recommended it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: This tiller ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to use the CORRECT electric cord to power this tiller, if you dont you can burn it out!This Tiller by Sun Joe is the Bomb! It is perfect for tilling up your hard garden ground, tilling in soil imp rovers, and getting rid of weed patches. It has some real grab, but feels safe and ergonomically comfortable. Wear safety goggles as rocks can fly up while tilling. I also have a sun joe mower, 3rd year now and just love it. if you keep these machines dry and clean, they will serve you for many years! I love these two garden items, i feel lik ethey are my new toys! they work GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Green Goddess

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think it was going to work because it doesn’t have a anchor or post bar to make it dig in. But it works anyway. Now if I can get her to mow the lawn......,
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe but works
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the safety switch was either broken or not functional. This safety device must work to prevent inadvertent motion by the tiller hurting its user. Besides the faulty (or badly engineered switch), the tiller functions well and does it job as designed.
customer_reviews.author: labwiz

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Powerful for an electric tiller. Easy to handle especially backwards. I have had problems with the safety release sticking so it occasionally runs for several seconds after I release it.
customer_reviews.author: jody bolduc

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little guy
customer_reviews.text: This thing might be small but it actually works very well. When first starting it you better be hanging on tight cause it really wants to take off on you. I had no problem digging down the full depth of the tines in virgin soil. The only problem with doing that is when your down that deep it does tend to bog down the tines a bit so I had to try to keep it a little shallower. I always had a gas powered tiller but I am trying to go more green and I am very impressed with this model. It definitely did the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sadowski

customer_reviews.title: Good little tiller
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller did a great job. A few tips that I learned; if starting a new bed, be sure that the ground is somewhat dry, flip the dirt with a shovel to give the tiller something to grab. It does a good job of breaking up the dirt, it's light weight, easy to assemble, and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bradley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard, say 20 x 35feet that I needed to sod. This worked great to prep the soil which was packed down with tufts of grass. After I tilled they yard I went on the flower beds, this did a great job. It is pretty quiet, yes it does spit dirt a little but not a deal breaker at all. I think this will last quite awhile and serve my needs just fine. Not heavy, not huge, so if you have limited space (including storage) and can't deal with a monster tiller, this is great. I would recommend this to anybody. Thanks to all the other reviewers for helping me make this choice.
customer_reviews.author: The Beetz

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love... With my tiller!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!! I put it together yesterday and tilled by huge new flowerbed. My fiancé had done half of it with a pickax (removing sod in heavy clay soil requires POWER!!) and it only took me an hour to finish the bed with this tiller! Now my soul is free from grass and has fluffy soil! Today I'm going to use it to expand my beds in the front yard. It is a powerful machine, so it's a workout for your arms (depending on what you are trying to till through).
customer_reviews.author: Starygrl

customer_reviews.title: as with any tool, it responds to how you ...
customer_reviews.text: as with any tool, it responds to how you treat it. if its hard pan or clay let it work through it. remember it's a small tiller with a big bite. I have used it many times on several types of soil from established garden beds that needed a spring till, to laying in a new garden with 25ft rows with clay, sand, and hard pan areas. I also have run it with 200ft of extension cords with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Bailey

customer_reviews.title: but it makes it quick and easy for my brothers to help her out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom, the gardener, for Mother's Day. She is getting up in years and can no longer handle digging by hand. She may not be able to do this herself, but it makes it quick and easy for my brothers to help her out. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Oceankath

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this tiller !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a garden now for the first time in over 10 yrs. I'm a senior citizen, and the regular tillers are just too heavy for me. This one is light enough I can carry it with one hand. And it did an awesome job on my ground, which had not been touched in over 10 yrs. I had my garden tilled in under 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: rutubaga

customer_reviews.title: More than does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is a beast for the size. It's easy to put together, easy to handle and really gets the job done. Just wish I would have gotten one sooner. I have sand, clay and dirt. Eats through it all.
customer_reviews.author: Texast

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and works just fine for the small plot we garden. UPDATE: Husband reports that if we had rented this item first, we'd be ordering it on Amazon for keeps. Wonderful piece of machinery.
customer_reviews.author: DayTrader

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Having read the reviews before purchasing I thought it would do a good job. It surpassed all of my expectations. My first test area was grass covered and mostly dry, hard clay soil. As others had mentioned, after letting the tiller go forward pull it back and redo the same area and it does a fantastic job. Very pleased with this product and would recommend to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this smaller tiller that works great between rows and for my flowe beds
customer_reviews.text: I have a Troy Built large tiller I use in spring and fall to break ground with. I purchased this smaller tiller that works great between rows and for my flowe beds. Well built and lightweight. Wotk really well fot mixing soils and adding fertilizer. Digs fast and hard. Great little tiller.
customer_reviews.author: V mann

customer_reviews.title: Totally impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to till a very weedy vegetable garden plot and really wondered if this thing was up to the job... And it took a couple of passes but it totally was. It performed extremely well, and only got clogged once (which is amazing since the weeds and grass were about a foot hight!) It isn't nearly as noisy as gas-powered tillers, doesn't smell at all and the cord is only a minor inconvenience. With the belt holder, I didn't have any trouble keeping the cord out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Farr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: It really cultivates well but because of its light weight, heavy clay soil causes it to bounce around a lot. I found that breaking up the ground with a pick and dampening it makes it work best. It's very powerful and if you don't hang on to it tightly, it can run away from you. It definitely met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, easy use
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It was easy to assemble and use. Perfect for my garden and flower beds. Best price i found for product also. Great product discription.
customer_reviews.author: ~Christel

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: I have a small garden plot and this tiller is just the right size. It is easy to handle and it turned the soil very well. I did have to make a couple of passes to get deep enough but it wasn't hard to do since the unit is so light weight and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisser Stand

customer_reviews.title: No gas or oil required. E-Z to handle and store
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 80 year old with small garden with tight maneuverability
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Eads

customer_reviews.title: Have used this cultivator for 3 years and love it. I had a Honda before but had ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this cultivator for 3 years and love it. I had a Honda before but had carburetor troubles that cost nearly as much as the tiller to replace. Don't let the fact that this thing is electric fool you. It has power and even though it has 6" tines it will dig into China if held in place. On sodded areas several passes may be required but on already cultivated gardens it's does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Riceke

customer_reviews.title: A Mighty Mite
customer_reviews.text: The tiller was easy to assemble; it took 5 minutes and I needed only a Phillips screwdriver. It's light enough to lift with one hand - a good feature since my garden is on the side of a hill in terraces. When I turned it on, it dug into the soil as if it were a much larger, heavier, stronger tiller. The power switch is on the right handle, making it very easy to turn off and on. All things considered, I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gridley

customer_reviews.title: and the first one was to clear away this super compacted dirt from the side of the house
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute beast! I have a few yard projects going, and the first one was to clear away this super compacted dirt from the side of the house. There was also deep-rooted grass growing in it. It was impossible to till by hand. This thing ate through that dirt like butter. I also used it to mix in cement mix to make a soil cement and it worked very well. For the price, it is hands down the best tiller out there! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wheatcraft

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for the first year (Spring and Fall)
customer_reviews.text: Works well...when it works. Worked fine for the first year (Spring and Fall), but now has a tendency to shut down often after a few minutes use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using it the first day i was amazed at how well it worked and the second day ...
customer_reviews.text: Using it the first day i was amazed at how well it worked and the second day made my life even easier. Then today after a few days of not using it, i went to tear up a patch of dirt and rock only to have it lose power then completely turn off. I am currently in the stages of testing to see if it just needs to cool longer but i am worried that it will need a replacement. Great product...until it stops working:/
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Pretty amazing
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this tiller, I was concerned that it wasn't going to have the power necessary to break through the hard ground that is (was!) my garden. Right from the moment I pulled the trigger for the first time I knew I was wrong. Very powerful, very fun to run. Light but strong enough to dig down 6-8" of hard dirt. I'm very happy I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: BBenson

customer_reviews.title: Works and the Price is Right
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy I bought this. It has made my life a lot easier. It tills the soil and turns to dirt. For a small garden it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: RFH

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: We just got the tiller. VERY impressed! My husband hadn't used a tiller before this season. Borrowed our neighbor's gas version (about a $700 tiller) before we got this in and he used the garden Joe immediately. Was instantly sold on this tiller and already planning many projects with it. Thanks to all of you who took the time to write reviews! That was the selling point for me ordering this particular tiller vs. other models. Will update my review at the end of the season! Happy gardening!
customer_reviews.author: Nursethis1965

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a lemon or ...
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed my new TJ600E today and ran it five feet over flat dirt before it just stopped. Now it just hums like a motor that is single phasing and won't run. I checked voltage at the outlet and have tried two different extension cords with same outcome. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Overland

customer_reviews.title: Nice but short lived
customer_reviews.text: Worked beautifully tilling up lawn and then died after about 3 weeks of periodic use. My husband is 76 yrs old so there was no heavy duty usage. We're very disappointed are are now waiting to hear from Sunjoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are starting on our yard work this year, and I don't know what we would do without this tiller! The garden beds what were there before we moved in were overgrown, and of course in Colorado the dirt is like clay. It's almost impossible to dig it out with a shovel unless you have all day. This makes the job so much easier, and we started a garden of our own and this helped blend all of our dirt and additives together. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: jenemycricket

customer_reviews.title: Mix very hard clay soil
customer_reviews.text: Many people said it broke or worn out. But my experience is totally different. I used it almost super rocky soil with heavy clay. It did not mix soil. Then i turned the soil around with a shovel. Later that it mixes rock hard clay into very soft small pieces. I really liked it. Sometimes it feels that it will stuck but no. Also it is not heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: selim kaya

customer_reviews.title: I have become a Sun Joe Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I was at first apprehensive with Sun Joe products.This is a great tiller and worked well in my landscaping and was very quick roto- tilling my beach.Since this purchase I have become a Sun Joe fan....lawnmower and pressure washer also...quick easy assembly and no problems after much use.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: ... as my birthday gift this year and it works great. Would give it a five
customer_reviews.text: This was given to me as my birthday gift this year and it works great. Would give it a five, but it kinda leaped out of my hand the first time I used it and the left black handle cracked. My sweetheart has used glue and tape to hold it together for me. Just finished tilling up my entire front yard. No problem
customer_reviews.author: clh1951

customer_reviews.title: This unit is very cheaply engineered. After using it ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very cheaply engineered.After using it for around 1 hour , I can hear the motor rotating but blades not working. Once I opened the gear box , connectors inside the gear box are made of plastic.Both male and female connectors were worn out. Sun Joe does not sell any parts for this machine through retailers including Amazon. I called the support and they do not have the parts in stock , will notify me when it will be available.
customer_reviews.author: ama-zon fan

customer_reviews.title: Took longer to assemble than to till 2 raised beds.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my two raised beds! Was a bit tough to line the handles up just right to assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: MissyG

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller
customer_reviews.text: We needed a tiller for the garden, it does all right, it is a little stony where we planted, but it did fine in the clay. After one year of use I gave up. It cannot handle the rocks in our clay. The screws pulled out of the aluminum, breaking the transmission. I got a different one from Earthwise instead. I needed something a little more durable,
customer_reviews.author: Lee G

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this, so easy for me to use and I am a tiny girly girl. It worked like a charm. Only issue I had was that the lawn that had been put in prior had green netting and it got all tangled in the blades and was a pain to cut and remove. Otherwise what a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS it is pure garbage. STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and I really wish I did not. I used it for a good 5 minutes and thought great...... this is a good product... Then guess what? The engine started buzzing and 10 minutes alter I gave up. I am returning to Amazon and going to invest in a gas unit . I wish i would have read all the bad reviews cause this company seems to make inferior products. Lesson learned ...
customer_reviews.author: RAT ARF and Big Bos

customer_reviews.title: Okay for price not great
customer_reviews.text: It's good and covinient for the price. However, it's not very durable. After two uses it stoped working. Not sure what happens but it seems that the motor got worn out. It completed the job that it was intended for but would have liked for it to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: MarFlores

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty powerful little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty powerful little machine! I tilled up my vegetable garden & a new flower bed in about 45 minutes with this thing. Assembly was a breeze & the customer service is great! I had a t clamp arrive broken & it's being shipped to me. I'll update my review if anything goes amiss there. So far, I'm pretty happy!
customer_reviews.author: Nissa

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. It works just like the live demonstration in the description. Pulverizes the dirt just like a larger model would.
customer_reviews.author: Shop til you drop

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this
customer_reviews.text: unless the ground is already soft it will not work properly, and after use of about 5 minutes started smoking, have to use and stop use and stop not what i expected when i want to work i want to continue until im done!!!!!!! Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tiller, it is perfect for small jobs. I bought it for a vegetable garden but have used it in all flower beds and I even tilled and replanted my back lawn (25' x 40'). It is very powerful and I like that it is electric rather than gas. It is quiet (compared to gas) and no fuss at all, just plug it in and get to work. Very easy to assemble, a few bolts to attach the upper handles. Great, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Great electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: Great electric tiller. The handles should be made better though and not be made of plastic. Hairline cracks from manufacturer assembled pieces getting bigger with use. The actual tiller works very well though, I'm sure this tiller will outlast the handle bars.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it around my yard for about a month now with no problems. And I had it to do again, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ted J.

customer_reviews.title: One bad fault
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little machine for small garden soil areas. Problem is it badly needs dirt shields. It kicks out way too much dirt to the sides which makes it mostly useless for tilling a raised bed or the edge of a garden. You need to stay 8 inches away from any edge that you don't want to cover with tilled soil. With dirt shields I'd rate this machine 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: Its great for me in little spaces
customer_reviews.text: Its great for me in little spaces ,just did a new flower bed about 3 ft wide and 16 ft long great job
customer_reviews.author: Liz Mays

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: First off the screws to attach the handles are flimsy and strip easily before fully attached. Second, it ran for one second then froze up and the engine started to smoke. It hadn't even started to dig yet.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

product_meta.title: Sun Joe TJ600E Joe 14-Inch 6.5 Amp Electric Tiller/Cultivator, 6.0
product_meta.description: LET'S BREAK GROUND. This garden tiller is ideal for starting a new garden or recovering an old lawn. The Sun Joe TJ600E electric tiller and cultivator combines the performance of a gas-powered machine with the convenience of an electric-powered tool. Weighing in at just under 19 pounds, the TJ600E electric tiller and cultivator is lightweight enough tote around your lawn, yet still packs a fierce punch with its powerful 6. 5-amp motor. This electric tiller cultivates an area 14-inches wide and up to 7-inches deep. Sun Joe's four steel angled tines efficiently and effortlessly loosen the ground to make planting and dirt removal quick and easy. Say goodbye to labor-intensive hand tools and unnecessary user strain! Sun Joe starts instantly with the push of a button and is completely maintenance free. This electric tiller is backed by a 2 year and merits the ETL seal of approval.
feature_bullets: ✅ VERSATILE: Ideal for small to mid-sized gardens and flowerbeds
✅ POWERFUL: Powerful 6.5-amp motor cultivates up to 14" wide x 7" deep
✅ DURABLE: 4 steel tilling blades for maximum durability and performance
✅ MAINTENANCE-FREE: No gas, oil or tune-ups make it effortless to start and maintain

✅ WE’VE GOT YOU COVERED! : Your new tiller + cultivator is backed by the Snow Joe + Sun Joe Customer Promise. We will warrant new, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. NO QUESTIONS ASKED. Contact Snow Joe + Sun Joe customer support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars769 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
